required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open Label Comparative Study On Celecoxib Efficacy And Safety Vs Non-Selective NSAID In Acute Pain Due To Ankle Sprain
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Randomized Multicenter Comparative Study On Celecoxib Efficacy And Safety Versus Non-Selective NSAID In Acute Pain Due To Ankle Sprain

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the efficacy of celecoxib loading dose of 400mg followed by 200 mg twice a day (BID) versus oral non-selective NSAIDs in acute pain due to ankle sprain.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline at Day 3 in Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) - Per Protocol Population

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) - Modified Intent to Treat Population
Number of Subjects Responding (Improving) - MITT Population
Subject's Global Assessment of Ankle Injury

arm_group.description: nsNSAIDs used in real-life standard practice for treatment of pain due to ankle sprain.

intervention.description: Non-selective NSAIDs administered at usual (standard) doses.
celecoxib with an initial loading dose of 400 mg followed by 200 mg twice daily (BID) for up to 7 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with first acute ankle sprain episode in the last six months classified as grade I or II, confirmed by X-rays, according to the following definitions:
- Grade I: When the ligament is stretched but not torn and the anterior talofibular ligament is usually involved. The anterior draw test is negative.
- Grade II: Moderate sprains which usually result in partial tears af the ligaments, primarily the anterior talofibular and possibly the calcaneofibular ligament. Ligamentous laxity may be present and there is moderate swelling.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have a similar injury of the same joint within the last six months; or
- clinical evidence of complete rupture of ankle ligaments (third degree sprain), or
- requirements for bed rest, hospitalization, surgical intervention for the ankle injury; or
- evidence of fractures; or non-removable full cast of any tipe; or
- presence of bilateral occurrence of ankle injury or ipsilateral ankle and knee injury.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Ankle sprain, acute pain, NSAID, celecoxib,

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Locations used were emergency rooms at orthopedic hospitals, general hospitals or private doctor’s offices
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects sustained ankle sprain with a pain rating of greater than or equal to 45mm on a visual analog scale on full weight bearing, no more than 48 hours prior to the first dose of study medication

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: All participants randomized to celecoxib were treated with 2 capsules of celecoxib 200 mg as a loading dose, thereafter, participants took 1 capsule of celecoxib 200 mg twice daily (morning and evening), for up to 7 days. Approximately a 12 hour interval was maintained between doses.

group.title: nsNSAIDs
group.description: All participants randomized to non-selective non-steroidal anti inflammatory drugs (nsNSAIDs) took the first dose and all subsequent doses according to the standard treatment practice for treatment of pain due to ankle sprain, for up to 7 days.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: All participants randomized to celecoxib were treated with 2 capsules of celecoxib 200 mg as a loading dose, thereafter, participants took 1 capsule of celecoxib 200 mg twice daily (morning and evening), for up to 7 days. Approximately a 12 hour interval was maintained between doses.

group.title: nsNSAIDs
group.description: All participants randomized to non-selective non-steroidal anti inflammatory drugs (nsNSAIDs) took the first dose and all subsequent doses according to the standard treatment practice for treatment of pain due to ankle sprain, for up to 7 days.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender

outcome.title: Change From Baseline at Day 3 in Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) - Per Protocol Population
outcome.description: Assessment of ankle pain by VAS: 100 mm horizontal line with left end being “No Pain” & right end being “Worst Possible Pain”. Participants drew vertical line on horizontal scale to best reflect current pain on full weight bearing of injured ankle. Distance from left end of line to mark. Change: mean score at day 3 minus mean score at baseline
outcome.population: Per protocol (PP) population included subjects who were randomized, received full loading dose of study medication on day 1 and took no prohibited medications up to and including day 3, had valid baseline and day 3 VAS scores and had no major protocol violations before or during the study (i.e. a subset of treated subjects).

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: All participants randomized to celecoxib were treated with 2 capsules of celecoxib 200 mg as a loading dose, thereafter, participants took 1 capsule of celecoxib 200 mg twice daily (morning and evening), for up to 7 days. Approximately a 12 hour interval was maintained between doses.

group.title: nsNSAIDs
group.description: All participants randomized to non-selective non-steroidal anti inflammatory drugs (nsNSAIDs) took the first dose and all subsequent doses according to the standard treatment practice for treatment of pain due to ankle sprain, for up to 7 days.

measure.title: Change From Baseline at Day 3 in Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) - Per Protocol Population
measure.description: Assessment of ankle pain by VAS: 100 mm horizontal line with left end being “No Pain” & right end being “Worst Possible Pain”. Participants drew vertical line on horizontal scale to best reflect current pain on full weight bearing of injured ankle. Distance from left end of line to mark. Change: mean score at day 3 minus mean score at baseline
measure.population: Per protocol (PP) population included subjects who were randomized, received full loading dose of study medication on day 1 and took no prohibited medications up to and including day 3, had valid baseline and day 3 VAS scores and had no major protocol violations before or during the study (i.e. a subset of treated subjects).

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: To conclude non inferiority, the lower bound of the 2-sided 95% confidence interval of the difference in change scores between the 2 treatment groups (nsNSAIDs - celecoxib) must be greater than –10 mm.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) - Modified Intent to Treat Population
outcome.description: Assessment of ankle pain by VAS: 100 mm horizontal line, left end being “No Pain” & right end being “Worst Possible Pain”. Participants drew vertical line on horizontal scale to best reflect current pain on full weight bearing of injured ankle. Distance from left end of line to mark. Change: mean score at observation minus mean score at baseline
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment (i.e. a subset of treated subjects).

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: All participants randomized to celecoxib were treated with 2 capsules of celecoxib 200 mg as a loading dose, thereafter, participants took 1 capsule of celecoxib 200 mg twice daily (morning and evening), for up to 7 days. measure.title: Change From Baseline in Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) - Modified Intent to Treat Population

Change: mean score at observation minus mean score at baseline
measure.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment (i.e. a subset of treated subjects).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Responding (Improving) - MITT Population
outcome.description: The number of subjects showing a response: a decrease of at least 20 mm (that is improvement) on the pain visual analog scale (VAS) scale
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment (i.e. a subset of treated subjects).

outcome.title: Subject's Global Assessment of Ankle Injury
outcome.description: Subject response to question: “Considering all the ways your ankle injury affects you, how are you doing today?” Scale: 5 point from 1 = very good (no symptoms and no limitation of normal activities) to 5 = very poor (very severe symptoms which are intolerable and inability to carry out all normal activities).
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment

outcome.title: Subject Assessment of Normal Function / Activity
outcome.description: Subject response to question: “How does your ankle injury affect your walking and normal activity?” Scale from 1 = Normal walking/activity and no pain to 5 = Severely restricted walking due to pain and can’t resume normal activities (normal activities defined as all activity that a subject did on a routine basis, including work and recreation)
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment

outcome.title: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf) - Pain Severity Question 1
outcome.description: m-BPI-sf questionnaire assessed pain severity and pain interference with functional activities during the 24 hour follow-up period. Q1: Subject response to 'describe your pain at its worst in the last 24 hours'. Scale: 0 = no pain to 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment

outcome.title: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf) - Pain Severity Index
outcome.description: m-BPI-sf questionnaire assessed pain severity and pain interference with functional activities during the 24 hour follow-up period. Pain severity index is the average of the pain severity questions 1 to 4. Scale: 0 = no pain to 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment

outcome.description: m-BPI-sf questionnaire assessed pain severity and pain interference with functional activities during the 24 hour follow-up period. Q5A: Subject response to ‘how, during the past 24 hours, pain has interfered with your general activity. Scale: 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes

measure.title: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf) – Pain Interference Question 5C
measure.description: m-BPI-sf questionnaire assessed pain severity and pain interference with functional activities during the 24 hour follow-up period. Q5C: Subject response to ‘how, during the past 24 hours, pain has interfered with your walking ability’. Scale: 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes
measure.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment

outcome.title: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf) – Pain Interference Question 5D
outcome.description: m-BPI-sf questionnaire assessed pain severity and pain interference with functional activities during the 24 hour follow-up period. Q5D: Subject response to ‘how, during the past 24 hours, pain has interfered with your normal work (work outside the home and housework)’. Scale: 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: All participants randomized to celecoxib were treated with 2 capsules of celecoxib 200 mg as a loading dose, thereafter, participants took 1 capsule of celecoxib 200 mg twice daily (morning and evening), for up to 7 days. Approximately a 12 hour interval was maintained between doses.

group.title: nsNSAIDs
group.description: All participants randomized to non-selective non-steroidal anti inflammatory drugs (nsNSAIDs) took the first dose and all subsequent doses according to the standard treatment practice for treatment of pain due to ankle sprain, for up to 7 days.

measure.description: m-BPI-sf questionnaire assessed pain severity and pain interference with functional activities during the 24 hour follow-up period. measure.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment

measure.description: m-BPI-sf questionnaire assessed pain severity and pain interference with functional activities during the 24 hour follow-up period. outcome.title: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf) – Pain Interference Index
outcome.description: m-BPI-sf questionnaire assessed pain severity and pain interference with functional activities during the 24 hour follow-up period. The pain interference index is the average of pain interference questions 5A to 5G. Scale: 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes
outcome.population: Modified intent to treat (MITT) population included subjects who were randomized, received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one follow up pain VAS score assessment

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
